content.question: The parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> given by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> is defined for <math alttext="negative 1 less or equal than t less or equal than 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. The graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is entirely in Quadrant IV in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane. Which of the following could define <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parentheses t squared minus 2 comma t cubed minus 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses t squared minus 2 comma t cubed plus 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses t squared plus 2 comma t cubed minus 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses t squared plus 2 comma t cubed plus 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parentheses t squared plus 2 comma t cubed minus 2 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
